body_html:
@jkeller-miovision what are the repro steps? valgrind python -c "import tensorflow"?

It would help a lot of you could rebuild tensorflow with debug symbols bazel build -c dbg //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package and run again to get the line numbers.

If you build with asan, there should also be some report of dangling objects at exit.

It's probable that it's one of those global static variables that we have.

It would help a lot of you could rebuild tensorflow with debug symbols bazel build -c dbg //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package and run again to get the line numbers.

body:
@jkeller-miovision what are the repro steps? `valgrind python -c "import tensorflow"`?

It would help a lot of you could rebuild tensorflow with debug symbols `bazel build -c dbg //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package` and run again to get the line numbers.

If you build with `asan`, there should also be some report of dangling objects at exit.

It's probable that it's one of those global static variables that we have.
